sentences: Daniel Lawrence Warner (April 22, 1970 – September 4, 2019) was an American Grammy Award and Latin Grammy Award winning guitarist, record producer and songwriter.
Warner was born and grew up in South Florida.
He was the governor of The Recording Academy starting from 2005 and was the President of Recording Academy Florida Chapter from 2010 to 2012, and a Trustee for the period from 2013 until 2017.

Warner received a Grammy for Best Latin Pop album for his work as a producer and engineer on Alejandro Sanz's 2009 album  at the 53rd Grammy awards, and received four Latin Grammy awards for his work on Calle13's album, Entren Los Que Quieran, Amaury Gutierrez's Sesiones Intimas, Diego Torres's Distinto and the aforementioned Paraíso Express.
